commit_subject: build: disable reduced exports by default
reasoning: HOdlcoin already defaults reduce-exports to 'no' (verified). The fix is already present — no security risk exists in target.

commit_subject: build: disable reduced exports by default
reasoning: Litecoin already defaults reduce-exports to 'no' (verified). Fix already applied — no security risk.

commit_subject: build: disable reduced exports by default
reasoning: Bitcoin Classic already defaults reduce-exports to 'no' (verified). Fix already applied.

commit_subject: build: disable reduced exports by default
reasoning: Truthcoin still defaults reduce-exports to 'auto' (verified). The unreliable symbol export behavior on older runtimes (FreeBSD 9, Debian Wheezy) could cause exception handling failures. Security risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge branch cachyos_10.0 native into main
reasoning: CachyOS-specific merge with native package customizations (SUBJOBS variable, cross-compiler prefix changes). Not a security fix — fork-specific build optimization not applicable to upstream Proton.

commit_subject: Another attempt to install llvm-14
reasoning: 1harios/ClickHouse still uses manual GPG key download + apt-key for LLVM repo (verified). The deprecated apt-key approach and manual hash verification is less secure than using software-properties-common. Security risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge branch cachyos_9.0 cachy into main
files_changed: .gitmodules; Makefile.in; configure.sh; make/rules-*.mk; proton; steam_helper/steam.cpp; etc.
reasoning: CachyOS-specific merge changing Wine submodule to CachyOS/wine-cachyos. Fork-specific customization — no security risk for upstream Proton.

commit_subject: Merge tag branch-0.16 into sys_leveldb-0.16
reasoning: Large branch-level merge (0.16) with dozens of scattered changes across CI, docs, and build files. Not a targeted security patch — too broad to sync as a single unit. Would require cherry-picking individual security-relevant changes.

commit_subject: Merge upstream/master (build/guix changes)
reasoning: Mixed merge with security-relevant changes (security-check.py path fixes) and documentation. Litecoin shares the build system but may lack Guix-specific paths. Partial risk — the devtools security check path changes are relevant.

commit_subject: Update xsns_53_sml.ino
reasoning: Upstream Tasmota has mixed LOG_LEVEL_INFO and LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG for decryption logging (verified). The commit changes INFO→DEBUG to reduce verbose logging of decrypted data. Partial risk — sensitive decryption info may be logged at INFO level.

commit_subject: build: Add -fvisibility=hidden flag for macOS host
reasoning: Litecoin's darwin.mk only has '-pipe' in darwin_CFLAGS — no -fvisibility=hidden (verified). Missing this flag means more symbols are exported than necessary in macOS builds, increasing attack surface. Security risk confirmed.

commit_subject: cachyos: strip binaries early
reasoning: CachyOS-specific build optimization replacing debug flags with strip. Not a security fix — different forks have different stripping strategies. No security risk for umu-proton.

commit_subject: build refactor: Drop useless call Make function
reasoning: Bitcoin upstream already has the simplified $($(1)_fetch_cmds) pattern (verified). Fix already applied. Also not a security fix — pure code quality refactoring.

commit_subject: Merge 13134 via optional_bip61-0.16
reasoning: btc1 (SegWit2x) appears to be archived/inactive. The BIP61 optional reject message feature is a multi-file merge. Even if the repo exists, it likely hasn't been maintained, making the sync moot.

commit_subject: Merge branches cachyos_9.0 umu and cachy into main
files_changed: .gitmodules; Makefile.in; configure.sh; make/rules-*.mk; patches/*; proton; etc.
reasoning: CachyOS-specific merge with 20 files including fork-specific patches. Not a security concern for upstream Proton.

commit_subject: Merge branch master into passive_anticheat_new
reasoning: Massive 74-file merge integrating master into a feature branch. Not a targeted security patch — it is a full branch sync. Target is upstream TrinityCore which already has its own master branch.

commit_subject: Add missing sudo entry in gitian VM setup
reasoning: Faircoin's gitian-building.md has lxc-start sudo entry but missing lxc-execute entry (verified). Without this entry, gitian builds may fail or require manual password entry, potentially leading to insecure workarounds. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge remote-tracking branch origin/master into mmaps
reasoning: Large 72-file merge updating dependencies (bzip2, zlib, gsoap) and gameplay systems. Not a targeted security patch — full branch integration. Target is upstream which already has these changes.

commit_subject: secp256k1 in makefile.osx
reasoning: Primecoin's makefile.osx does NOT link secp256k1 (verified). This means macOS builds lack the optimized elliptic curve library. However, this is a very old commit and primecoin may use a completely different build system now, so the patch may not apply cleanly.

commit_subject: Build kererberized_hadoop image via https
reasoning: 1harios/ClickHouse already uses Docker ADD instruction for commons-daemon download (verified). Fix already applied — no security risk.

commit_subject: Remove no longer needed deadlock TSan suppression
reasoning: Bitcoin Knots still has 'deadlock:Chainstate::ConnectTip' suppression (verified, slightly different naming). Stale suppressions mask potential real deadlock bugs. Risk confirmed — should be removed to enable proper bug detection.

commit_subject: Merge remote-tracking branch tc/master
reasoning: Large 56-file merge. Not a targeted security patch. Target is upstream TrinityCore which already has these changes in master.

commit_subject: ensure gpgv is latest version in ubuntu docker image
reasoning: ClickHouse upstream Dockerfile.ubuntu does NOT include gpgv in apt-get install (verified). The commit references CVE-2025-68973. Without updating gpgv, the Docker image may use a vulnerable GPG verification tool. Security risk confirmed.

commit_subject: build: strip binaries early
reasoning: CachyOS-specific build modification. Not a security fix for upstream Proton.

commit_subject: bump qt to 5.12.4
reasoning: Litecoin uses Qt 5.9.8 (verified) which is significantly outdated. Qt 5.12.4 includes security patches. However, the version gap (5.9.8→5.12.4) means SHA256 hashes and possibly package naming differ, so the commit applies but the target needs even newer Qt.

commit_subject: Merge branch cachyos_9.0 cachy into main
reasoning: CachyOS-specific merge. Not applicable to upstream Proton.

commit_subject: Delete security_pls_2_0.sub
reasoning: v1nc/flipperzero-firmware still has the security_pls_2_0.sub file (verified). This is a Security+ 2.0 protocol test file at 315MHz. Its removal suggests it contained sensitive/unnecessary test data. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Remove UBSan suppression (streams.h)
reasoning: Litecoin's ubsan file does NOT contain 'unsigned-integer-overflow:streams.h' (verified). The suppression was already removed or never added. No risk.

commit_subject: Merge depends_qt_update-27
reasoning: kallewoof/bitcoin uses Qt 5.15.11 (verified). The commit bumps to 5.15.14 which includes security patches. Risk confirmed — outdated Qt dependency.

commit_subject: Remove sanitizer suppression for netaddress.cpp
reasoning: MicroBitcoin does not have test/sanitizer_suppressions/ubsan file (verified — 404). The file doesn't exist in the target repo, so the commit cannot be applied. No risk.

commit_subject: Merge 11622 via bip70_disable-0.15
files_changed: configure.ac; src/Makefile.am; src/Makefile.qt.include; src/Makefile.qttest.include; src/qt/bitcoin.cpp; src/qt/coincontroldialog.cpp; src/qt/guiutil.cpp; src/qt/paymentserver.cpp
reasoning: btc1 (SegWit2x) appears inactive/archived. BIP70 disabling is security-relevant (reduces attack surface from payment protocol), but the 8-file merge across build and Qt code would likely conflict. Target repo maintenance status makes sync impractical.

commit_subject: scripted-diff: Bump actions/checkout version
reasoning: Syscoin's ci.yml uses v3 in the win64-native job but v4 elsewhere (verified). actions/checkout v3 uses a deprecated Node.js version. Partial risk — one workflow job still uses the old version.

commit_subject: dynamic script size
reasoning: The commit increases SCRIPT_MAXSSIZE from 48 to 255 bytes and adds dynamic sizing with validation (10-255 range). Target is upstream Tasmota. If the fixed buffer size was too small, it could cause buffer-related issues. Risk exists if upstream hasn't independently applied this.

commit_subject: dynamic script size
reasoning: stefanbode/Sonoff-Tasmota likely has the scripter driver with the old fixed 48-byte buffer. If the file exists and hasn't been independently updated, the buffer limitation risk applies.

commit_subject: Backport fix kerberized_hadoop Dockerfile
reasoning: 1harios/ClickHouse already uses Docker ADD (verified). This is a duplicate of the same fix as 5645cbe0. Already applied — no risk.

commit_subject: Merge upstream/master: add project governance files
reasoning: Adds Forgejo platform governance files. Not a security fix — repo management infrastructure. No security risk to upstream FFmpeg.

commit_subject: guix: exclude apple debug symbols from hash list
reasoning: Target is bitcoin/bitcoin upstream. This fixes non-deterministic Apple debug symbol hashing that could cause GPG attestation signature mismatches. Without this fix, build verification may fail, undermining supply chain security. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: proton: disable proton media converter
reasoning: CachyOS-specific workaround for missing Wine patch. Upstream Proton has the Wine patch and doesn't need the media converter disabled. No risk.

commit_subject: test: remove GetRNGState lsan suppression
reasoning: Litecoin still has 'leak:GetRNGState' in its lsan suppression file (verified). This stale suppression masks a false-positive that has been resolved. Keeping it clutters sanitizer output and may mask real leaks. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Do not shadow variables (gcc set)
files_changed: configure.ac; src/arith_uint256.cpp; src/bench/lockedpool.cpp; src/chain.h; src/script/*.cpp; src/script/*.h; src/streams.h; src/support/lockedpool.cpp; src/test/coins_tests.cpp; src/timedata.h; src/wallet/wallet.cpp
reasoning: Enables -Wshadow compiler warning and renames shadowed variables across 14 files. Variable shadowing can cause subtle bugs in security-critical code (e.g., script/interpreter.h). Bitcoin Classic likely has the shadowed variables, but the 14-file merge scope makes clean application difficult.

commit_subject: Merge branch arendst/master
reasoning: Updates GitHub templates and stale bot config. Not a security fix — repo governance changes. No security risk.

commit_subject: Remove no longer needed deadlock TSan suppression
reasoning: Bitcoin Knots still has 'deadlock:Chainstate::ConnectTip' (verified). Stale deadlock suppression may mask real concurrency bugs in chain tip connection. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: guix: use LIEF 0.17.2
reasoning: Target is bitcoin/bitcoin upstream. LIEF 0.16.6→0.17.2 update may include security fixes for the binary analysis library used in build verification. Risk confirmed if upstream still uses older version.

commit_subject: test: Add UBSan suppression for secp256k1
reasoning: Bitcoin Knots already has extensive secp256k1 UBSan suppressions including 'implicit-integer-sign-change:secp256k1/' and 'implicit-signed-integer-truncation:secp256k1/' (verified). Fix already applied — no risk.

commit_subject: kitware gpg fix
reasoning: 1harios/ClickHouse uses deprecated apt-key for GPG handling (verified from LLVM check — same Dockerfile). The Kitware GPG fix modernizes key management with signed-by directive. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: test zmq: Drop no longer needed TSan suppressions
reasoning: Litecoin still has 'race:zmq::*' and 'race:libzmq' suppressions (verified — 45 entries total). These stale suppressions mask potential ZMQ race conditions. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: test zmq: Drop no longer needed TSan suppressions
reasoning: Target is bitcoin/bitcoin upstream. Upstream has already simplified to direct variable expansion pattern (verified for funcs.mk). The TSan file would likewise be current. No risk.

commit_subject: test zmq: Drop no longer needed TSan suppressions
reasoning: Dash uses ZMQ and inherits Bitcoin's test infrastructure. Likely has stale ZMQ race suppressions similar to Litecoin. Risk probable but not directly verified.

commit_subject: Merge #17033: Disable _FORTIFY_SOURCE when enable-debug
reasoning: btc1's configure.ac does NOT conditionally disable _FORTIFY_SOURCE in debug mode (verified). This causes spurious compiler warnings and _FORTIFY_SOURCE is ineffective without optimization, giving false sense of security hardening. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: test: UB step three (remove txmempool suppressions)
reasoning: Litecoin still has 'unsigned-integer-overflow:txmempool.cpp' and 'implicit-integer-sign-change:txmempool.cpp' suppressions (verified). These mask UB issues that have been fixed upstream. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Remove no longer needed deadlock TSan suppression
reasoning: Bitcoin Knots has 'deadlock:Chainstate::ConnectTip' (verified). Same stale suppression as e9197bd commit. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: test: Drop deadlock:CChainState::ConnectTip
reasoning: Bitcoin Knots has 'deadlock:Chainstate::ConnectTip' (verified). Same stale suppression. Risk confirmed — deadlock detection is silenced.

commit_subject: [Windows] Remove libxml2 dependency
reasoning: r3b/phantomjs already removed libxml2 from Windows LIBS (verified — only has -lCrypt32). Fix already applied — no risk.

commit_subject: Update snapcraft.yaml (lxc 3.0.1->3.0.3)
reasoning: anbox upstream still uses lxc-3.0.1 (verified). lxc 3.0.3 includes bug fixes and potentially security patches. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge branch separate_utils into 0.12.x-syslibs
reasoning: Build system refactoring to separate bitcoin-cli and bitcoin-tx options. Not a direct security fix — build organization improvement. Bitcoin Classic may have diverged significantly in build setup. Low security risk.

commit_subject: Merge 30198 via depends_qt_update-27
reasoning: kallewoof/bitcoin uses Qt 5.15.11 (verified). Commit updates to 5.15.14 with security patches. Risk confirmed — outdated Qt dependency with potential vulnerabilities.

commit_subject: ceph.spec.in: drop ceph-brag and ceph-post-file
reasoning: liewegas/ceph still includes both ceph-brag and ceph-post-file (verified). ceph-post-file uses SFTP to transmit logs to external servers — unnecessary network exposure. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: ceph.spec.in: add Prereq: permissions to radosgw package
reasoning: ceph/ceph upstream does not have PreReq: permissions in radosgw section (verified). SUSE-specific RPMLINT packaging compliance — missing prerequisite for permissions package during radosgw installation.

commit_subject: ceph.spec.in: add Prereq: permissions to radosgw package
reasoning: ceph/ceph upstream lacks PreReq: permissions in radosgw section (verified). Same SUSE-specific packaging fix cherry-picked to different branch.

commit_subject: fortify-headers: update to 0.8
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at fortify-headers 1.1 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: ca-certificates: update to version 20190110
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at ca-certificates 20210119 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: nghttp2: bump to 1.31.1
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at nghttp2 1.41.0 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: tools/e2fsprogs: Update to 1.44.2
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at e2fsprogs tools 1.45.6 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: dropbear: security update to 2016.74
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at dropbear 2022.82 (verified). The format string injection and other CVEs fixed in 2016.74 are long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: glibc: update to latest 2.27 commit (BZ #23927)
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at glibc 2.37 (verified). CVE-2018-19591 fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: ltq-vdsl-mei: disable optimized firmware download
reasoning: Disables an optimized firmware download feature that triggers watchdog reboots on systems without xDSL connection. Stability issue rather than security vulnerability. Lantiq-specific — low general security impact.

commit_subject: libs/gmp: update to 6.1.1
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at gmp 6.2.1 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: zlib: Update to 1.2.11
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at zlib 1.2.13 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: Merge upstream/master into k5 (JD dailybonus refactor)
reasoning: Refactors JD.com dailybonus automation package — build system simplification and UI changes. Not a security fix. No security risk to target.

commit_subject: ustream-ssl: update to latest git HEAD
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at ustream-ssl from 2020-03-13 (verified). Commit updates to 2018-07-30 version — target is already newer. No risk.

commit_subject: package/utils/e2fsprogs: Update to 1.44.3
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at e2fsprogs 1.47.0 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: package/utils/e2fsprogs: Update to 1.44.3
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at newer e2fsprogs version (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: image.mk: Generate cpiogz with root-owned files
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already uses '-R 0:0' in cpio command (verified). Root ownership fix already applied — no risk.

commit_subject: openvpn: update to v2.4.2
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at openvpn 2.5.0 (verified). CVE-2017-7478 and CVE-2017-7479 fixes long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: busybox: update to 1.29.3
reasoning: coolsnowwolf/lede already at busybox 1.36.1 (verified). Fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: wireguard: bump to 20171122
reasoning: libc0607/lede already at wireguard 1.0.20210124 (verified). Crypto state management fix long since superseded — no risk.

commit_subject: Remove sanitizer suppression implicit-signed-integer-truncation:netaddress.cpp
reasoning: MicroBitcoin's ubsan file does not contain 'implicit-signed-integer-truncation:netaddress.cpp' (verified). Suppression already absent — no risk.

commit_subject: Don't build libevent sample code
reasoning: bitcoinclassic/bitcoinclassic does NOT have --disable-samples in libevent.mk (verified). Sample code is built unnecessarily increasing attack surface. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge: compiler hardening (PIE/PIC flags)
reasoning: HOdlcoin/HOdlcoin already has HARDENED_CXXFLAGS with -fPIE and HARDENED_LDFLAGS with -pie (verified). Hardening flags already present — no risk.

commit_subject: Remove san suppression for testing
reasoning: Litecoin still has stale ubsan suppressions including 'unsigned-integer-overflow:validation.cpp' (verified). These mask potential issues. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge: OP_RETURN expansion
reasoning: Expands OP_RETURN to accept any sequence of pushdatas (80→83 byte limit). Protocol flexibility enhancement not a security fix. No security risk if target lacks this.

commit_subject: Merge: MinGW threading fix
reasoning: CoinBlack/blackcoin's makefile.mingw lacks -D_MT and -lmingwthrd flags (verified). Missing proper multi-threaded runtime support could cause runtime instability. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge: fuzz log output + GetRNGState lsan suppression
reasoning: Litecoin still has stale 'leak:GetRNGState' suppression (verified). This masks false-positive leak detection resolved upstream. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Fix Broken Linux Compiling Dependencies Instruction
reasoning: OmniLayer/omnicore's build-unix.md does NOT include libssl-dev in apt-get install (verified). Missing SSL development library documentation could lead to failed builds or insecure workarounds. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: Merge tag branch-0.16 into sys_leveldb-0.16
reasoning: Large branch-level merge (0.16) with dozens of changes. Same commit as from bitcoinknots fork — not a targeted security patch. Too broad to sync as single unit.

commit_subject: depends: update miniupnpc to 2.3.2
reasoning: dogecoin/dogecoin upstream still uses miniupnpc 2.0.20170509 (verified). Version 2.3.2 includes years of security fixes for UPnP handling. Risk confirmed.

commit_subject: [depends] Don't build libevent sample code
reasoning: dogecoin/dogecoin already has --disable-samples in libevent.mk (verified). Fix already applied — no risk.

commit_subject: Merge: thread-safety atomic operations
reasoning: cloudwu/skynet already uses ATOM_INIT/ATOM_LOAD/ATOM_STORE/ATOM_FDEC in lua-multicast.c (verified). Atomic operations already applied — no risk.

commit_subject: fix juggler build system classification
reasoning: Build configuration workaround marking juggler as internal component. Not a security fix — build system compatibility change. No security risk.

commit_subject: Bump i18n from 0.7.0 to 0.9.5 in /docs
reasoning: Documentation dependency bump (i18n gem). Not a runtime security fix — only affects docs site generation. No security risk to target.

commit_subject: Merge upstream/dev into android-refactor
files_changed: AppScreenSaver.cpp; CinderResources.h; Rect.h; TriMesh.h; Utilities.h; audio/Output.h; iOS boost libs; VS project files
reasoning: Platform-specific conditional compilation guards (macOS 10.7 screensaver GC; Win 8 audio targeting). Not a security fix — platform compatibility merge. No security risk.

commit_subject: Skip linking dashed built-ins on Windows
reasoning: Windows-only build optimization to skip deprecated dashed Git command hard-links. Not a security fix. Target is origin repo which already has this change.

commit_subject: Add permissions for flawfinder SAST workflow
reasoning: Target defcontastic has the flawfinder workflow but lacks security-events: write permission (verified). SAST results cannot be uploaded to GitHub security tab, creating a gap in vulnerability detection pipeline.

commit_subject: Centralize seccomp Kconfig across architectures
reasoning: Refactoring of seccomp Kconfig entries into centralized location. No functional change to seccomp behavior. Code reorganization only.

commit_subject: Fix PR c++/24173 template declaration handling
reasoning: C++ template handling fix from 2005 (PR c++/24173). Prevents compiler crash with duplicate template declarations. Not a security vulnerability.

commit_subject: Enable ASLR DEP and PIE for MSYS2 builds
reasoning: ASLR/DEP/PIE flags added for Windows MSYS2 builds (--nxcompat, --dynamicbase, --pic-executable). Target git-morphos is a MorphOS port - completely different platform. Windows-specific flags are irrelevant (verified: no such flags in target).

commit_subject: Add hide-refs hook documentation
reasoning: hide-refs hook allows servers to filter private references during protocol discovery, preventing unauthorized access to private commit data. felipec/git lacks this documentation and likely the feature (verified: no hide-refs in githooks.txt). Users serving repos with felipec/git cannot hide private refs.

commit_subject: Merge master into owrt branch (device configs)
files_changed: 51 files (device trees, WiFi drivers, bootloader configs)
reasoning: Large merge commit with device configuration updates for MediaTek routers, WiFi driver updates, and patch reorganizations. No security-relevant changes identified.

commit_subject: Disable automatic CI triggers (switch to manual compilation)
reasoning: Comments out push and pull_request CI triggers, switching to manual-only workflow_dispatch. Target is the origin repo. Not a security change - reduces automation rather than fixing vulnerabilities.

commit_subject: Disable OS debug output on ESP8266 (UART_OS=-1)
reasoning: Sets UART_OS=-1 to disable OS debug messages on ESP8266. Target micropython/micropython already has UART_OS=-1 (verified). Fix already applied.

commit_subject: Refresh Dropbear multi-hop SSH patch formatting
reasoning: Reformats Dropbear SSH patch metadata (removes git headers, truncates long lines). No functional or security change to the actual patch content.

commit_subject: Update libgcc-unwind.map to v2 linker map format
reasoning: Updates linker map format from v1 to v2 with improved symbol scoping and direct binding semantics. Illumos-specific change for Solaris linker compatibility. Marginal security relevance.

commit_subject: Git v2.47.3 security release (7 CVEs)
files_changed: bundle-uri.c; config.c; contrib/credential/wincred/git-credential-wincred.c; RelNotes; GIT-VERSION-GEN; +12 release notes
reasoning: Git v2.47.3 fixes CVE-2025-27613/27614/46334/46835/48384/48385/48386. schacon/git is already at v2.49.0-rc0 (verified), which is newer and includes all these fixes. No risk.

commit_subject: Enable ASLR PIE linker flags for MinGW
reasoning: Adds --pic-executable linker flags for MinGW32/64 to enable ASLR. Windows-specific. Target git-morphos is for MorphOS platform where these flags are irrelevant (verified: no such flags present).

commit_subject: Tune godot build defaults for libgodot IO usage
reasoning: Changes build defaults (disable tools, enable production, use system certs/TLS). These are opinionated libgodot-specific settings, not security fixes. Using bundled vs system TLS is a design choice, not a vulnerability.

commit_subject: Tune godot build defaults for libgodot IO usage
reasoning: Changes build defaults for libgodot use case. Target is origin repo with standard defaults. These are opinionated configuration preferences, not security vulnerabilities.

commit_subject: Tune godot build defaults for libgodot IO usage
reasoning: Changes build defaults for libgodot use case. Opinionated configuration preferences (system vs bundled TLS/certs), not security vulnerabilities.
